intro: Arachniodes jiulungshanensis, commonly known as the Jiulungshan shield fern, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its unique, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. Its leaves are bi-lobed and possess a distinctive, intricate venation pattern. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
